title: Rear Mudguard - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning

body.body: Guide the rear light sub harness through the frame and battery tray as noted during removal. Connect the rear light electrical connector to the harness.
Align the rear mudguard to the swinging arm and install two upper fixings. Do not tighten at this stage.

Ensuring the grommets are still in place, align the rear mudguard stay to the swinging arm and install the two flanged sleeves and fixings. Do not tighten at this stage.
Install the reflector brackets (if required) and rear mudguard stay bolts, washers and nuts, positioning the drive chain guard as noted during removal. Do not tighten at this stage.
